question: A flower has 10 stamens each having bilobed dithecous anther. If each microsporangium has 5 pollen mother cells, how many pollen grains would be produced by the flower?
explanation: 1 dithecous anther = 4 microsporangia. 10 stamens = 40 microsporangia. Total PMCs = <katex>$40 \times 5 = 200$</katex>. Each PMC produces 4 pollen grains. Total pollen = <katex>$200 \times 4 = 800$</katex>.
